tasks.name: Probabilistic Reversal Learning Task (PRLT)
tasks.definition: A reward-guided decision-making task with dynamically changing action-outcome contingencies. On each trial, subjects choose one of two abstract visual stimuli presented on a screen. The selected stimulus and its outcome (reward or punishment) are then displayed. The task includes multiple runs with different reward contingencies that shift unpredictably.
conditions: 20% left- and 80% right-hand choices leading to a reward, otherwise to a punishment
80% left- and 20% right-hand choices leading to a reward, otherwise to a punishment
50% left- and 50% right-hand choices leading to a reward, otherwise to a punishment
contrasts: positive prediction error (PE) > negative prediction error (PE)
negative prediction error (PE) > positive prediction error (PE)
